grade: Jōyō kanji, taught in junior high
on reading compounds: 亭【テイ】arbor, arbour, bower, pavilion, suffix forming the final part of the pseudonyms of some writers and performers, suffix forming the final part of the name of a restaurant
亭主【テイシュ】household head, master, host (e.g. of a tea gathering), innkeeper, owner (e.g. of an hotel), husband
料亭【リョウテイ】ryotei, traditional Japanese restaurant (esp. a luxurious one)
